introduction: This questionnaire allows you to capture the lessons that you've learned while running a specific event or trial.

chapters.title: Intake
chapters.description: _Fields marked with a * are mandatory._

questions.title: Title of the evaluated event? _title_
questions.description: _Short name to indicate the event and its evaluation (max. 70 characters)._

sections.title: Editors
sections.description: _Please provide the details of the main editors._

sections.title: Additional info
sections.description: _Free space for additional notes by the evaluators (max. 4 lines / 400 characters)._

sections.title: Publications
sections.description: Provide the title in English and, if applicable, the original language.

questions.title: How many publications do you have? _count_
How many multimedia sources do you have? _count_
Concerned phase of the disaster management cycle:

choices.title: Natural and Technological incidents
choices.output: - Incident category: Natural and Technological incidents

questions.title: Select all the incident types that apply:
How many EU member states are involved: _count_
Other involved critical infrastructure or societal sectors (if any) _additional_

sections.title: Organisations that were involved in executing CM functions
sections.output: ## Organisations that were involved in executing CM functions

choices.title: Search and Rescue
choices.output: Type of organisation: Search and Rescue

choices.title: NGO / Volunteer org.
choices.output: Type of organisation: NGO / Volunteer org.

questions.title: Text describing the evaluated event, challenges, problems, roles of the involved organisations: _description_
How many lessons did you discover? _count_
Select all the incident types that apply (up to 4):
Short description of the underlying observations _brief_
questions.description: _Describe the observation that leads/has led to the lesson._

questions.title: Detailed description of the underlying observations _details_
questions.description: _Describe the observation in detail that leads/has led to the lesson._
